page.title: 13FLETCHER BANK QUARRY
page.content: This open cast quarry was first dug in 1792. It is situated N of Bury near the M 66. About 25 men are employed in the quarry and about 100 at the nearby paving stone factory. The stone is {HELMSHAW GRIT}and { {FLETCHER BANK GRIT.}The stone is quarried using gelignite. The walls of the quarry collapsing onto the floor. The spoil heaps of waste material from the quarrying are covered with topsoil and grass is planted to prevent the quarry becoming an eyesore. The steepness of the sides of the quarry makes this a dangerous place and so it is surrounded by a barbed wire fence to prevent people and animals from danger.
